item.title: MrGibson add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: MrGibson add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Forgiveness is the fragrance that the violet sheds on the heel that has crushed it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: MrGibson add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Like so many Americans, she was trying to construct a life that made sense from things she found in gift shops." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: MrGibson add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "When the last living thing Has died on account of us, How poetical it would be If Earth could say, In a voice floating up Perhaps From the floor Of the Grand Canyon, "It is done." People did not like it here." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: MrGibson add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "The difference between stupid and intelligent people – and this is true whether or not they are well-educated – is that intelligent people can handle subtlety. " -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: MrGibson add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx
